A storage ottoman with removable tops can be a fantastic way to store bulky gear like running shoes, and it can also provide a convenient seat or bench in your closet.

And, absolutely, labeling the bins and shelves is an excellent idea! Labels can help you quickly identify what's stored in each bin or on each shelf, making it easier to find what you need and maintain your organized space. Here are some benefits of labeling your storage:

* **Easy identification:** Labels help you quickly identify what's stored in each bin or on each shelf, saving you time and reducing frustration.
* **Reduced clutter:** When everything has a designated home and is labeled, you're less likely to have clutter building up in your closet.
* **Improved maintenance:** Labels make it easier to maintain your organized space, as you can quickly see what needs to be restocked or cleaned.

When labeling your bins and shelves, consider the following tips:

* **Use clear and concise labels:** Choose labels that are easy to read and understand, and keep them concise to avoid cluttering up your space.
* **Use a consistent labeling system:** Use a consistent font, color scheme, and labeling style throughout your closet to create a cohesive look and make it easier to navigate.
* **Label the contents, not the category:** Instead of labeling a bin "Running Gear," label it "Running Shoes" or "Running Accessories" to make it more specific and helpful.
* **Use labels that are easy to update:** Consider using labels that are easy to update or replace, in case your storage needs change over time.

Some popular labeling options include:

* Adhesive labels or stickers
* Chalkboard labels or markers
* Removable label tags or clips
* Color-coded labels or tabs

By labeling your bins and shelves, you'll be able to quickly find what you need and maintain your organized space. Happy labeling!
